item.title: Strategy Pattern in Kotlin
item.description: Purpose The Strategy design pattern defines a family of algorithms and allows them to be used interchangeably. By algorithm, here I mean any logic, be it sorting, searching, or computing some value from data. It does not matter. It is, in a sense, an extension of the Template Method pattern, but inversely to it, Strategy prefers composition over inheritance. Strategies do not inherit from any specific class but only implement a common interface.

item.title: Kotlin Template Method
item.description: Purpose The template method is a very simple design pattern, that separates the shared class parts from distinctive ones. The core idea is to have an abstract parent class containing the algorithm steps and allowing inheriting classes to overwrite individual steps, but not the algorithm that uses those steps itself. Think about Pizza - steps to make it are more-less the same, despite the type of pizza. You need to make a dough, apply sauce and ingredients, and finally bake it.
